Get ready for some ‘diversity’ comedy

Comedian and actor Chris Rock, who will be hosting the Oscar Awards ceremony this year, is working on a whole new script and is planning to include jokes on its ‘lack of diversity’ controversy.

“Rock is hard at work for the Oscar night, as he has thrown out the script I wrote and is writing a new show,” Academy Awards producer Reginald Hudlin told etdonline.com.

“He and his writing staff locked themselves in a room as things got a little provocative and exciting,” he added. Hudlin confirmed that the 50-year-old comedian will include some #OscarsSoWhite jokes during the show. “And, yes, the Academy is ready for him to do that. They’re excited about him doing that,” he said. — IANS
title: Chris Rock writing his own script for Oscars
